page.title: 11Market Gardening, St Ouen
page.content: My dad has a field near to St Ouen's Manor in which he grows courgettes. The names of the seeds vary, Ambassador and President are the kinds we use on our land. We buy the seed from a seed merchant for Â£30 a tin. We planted the seeds on 25th June. To get rid of wees we use weedkiller. You can see the green foliage appearing after 10 days. We have 6 vegees (2.6 acres) of courgettes at the moment and we pick them by hand from the end of August to November. You have to have long sleeves to pick them because they prick you. Class one courgettes must not be curved. Class two are slightly curved, class three are large and curved. They are packed in tomato trays which have paper lids and are stamped with our own licence number. They are sent to Portsmouth in refrigerated lorries.
